newsitem.title: THAILAND: ASEAN group meets to boost exports of commodities.
newsitem.headline: ASEAN group meets to boost exports of commodities.

text.p: Trade and government officials from ASEAN countries met on Tuesday to map out strategies to boost foreign sales of their tapioca, canned pineapple, frozen shrimp, frozen chicken and canned tuna.
The Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) groups Brunei, Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand and Vietnam.

"This meeting of this forum is timely and significant, coming so soon after commencement of operation of World Trade Organisation," Ajva Tulananda, an executive board member of the Thai Chamber of Commerce, told reporters.

"Of particular concern is the nature of non-tariff barriers that are being formulated and that will be imposed to compensate for the liberalisation of trade and investment," said Ajva who chaired the meeting.
The meeting sought to push for lower tariffs in potential markets, reductions in non-tariff barriers and to promote technology transfers to break into markets, delegates said.
